Patient narratives:
90 year old man with acute right lower chest swelling sincefew months USG report tells no hepatic lesion, no subdiaphragmabscess, CXR shows no soft tissue or bony lesion - then can it beof cutaneous origin. blood report of acute infection. skinabscess? on palpation the swelling felt like a compressible gurglingmass reminiscent of hernia.  

See his CT scan here: USG abdomen report provided with the case tells normalimpression!! is there any infection in it? why neutrophil &ESR is high?.
Diagnosis: like abcess? inflammation?, Intercostal hernia, Rule out chest wall neoplasm
General Line of Treatment: Antibiotics, Surgical exploration and repair if hernia confirmed; incision and drainage if abscess; CT chest for definitive characterization

Patient narratives: 25 years old boy suffering from whole body pain since 2-3years.
Diagnosis: generalized body pain?, Fibromyalgia, Chronic widespread pain syndrome
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, Low-dose tricyclic antidepressants (amitriptyline), SNRIs (duloxetine), pregabalin, graded exercise therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy

Patient narratives: A 40 years old woman with Hypothyroidism since 5 years, irondeficiency anemia and nail changes since 2 years and progressivediffuse alopecia since 1 month: No koilonychia in this patient's nails.
Diagnosis: Autoimmune thyroiditis, Iron deficiency anemia, Diffuse alopecia, Brittle nail changes (without koilonychia)
General Line of Treatment: Thyroxine, Oral iron supplementation; biotin supplementation; treat underlying thyroid and iron deficiency to address alopecia and nail changes

Patient narratives: A 19 year old boy with fever for 2 weeks and recent evidenceof bilateral large pleural effusion with tachypnoea and withurine showing mild proteinuria with persistent active sediment:http://www.udhc.co.in/INPUT/displayIssueGraphically.jsp...Would appreciate your inputs on the diagnosis and plan forfurther management. This http://www.udhc.co.in/ViewImage?file_id=9819&scale=800was the reason for the patient's chest pain. The tap wasinitially showing 5000 WBC predominantly polymorphs alon withhigh pleural fluid to serum protein ratios and high pleural fluidLDH, s.
Diagnosis: Likely sepsis with infection related glomerulonephritis and synpneumonic effusion, Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) with lupus pleuritis, Lupus nephritis
General Line of Treatment: Antibiotics, Pleural drainage/thoracocentesis; ANA, anti-dsDNA, complement levels; nephrology referral; high-dose corticosteroids and hydroxychloroquine if SLE confirmed; immunosuppressants if nephritis confirmed

Patient narratives: 50yr old male....presented with fever...tiredness....since 1week....examination febrile..no other findings....inv....denguens1 positive ...platelets were 60000....graduallyimproved.....was complaining of pain abdomen ...usgnormal...upper gi endoscopy showed gr D reflux esophagitis andchronic active duodenal ulcer.rut negative....patient continuesto have fever since 10 days started on antibiotic.....chest xraybronchitis....occasional crepts clinically...i just got a call heis desaturating ...abg....ph 7.51.po2 60..pco2 12..hco316....what am i dealing with? Shreniapologies for my delayed reply and yes the possibility ofALI is very strong given the clinical scenario. I must ask you todelete some of the images shared here as they reveal thepatient's name and this will be a threat to his privacy. Thebes.
Diagnosis: Severe dengue, Acute Lung Injury (ALI)/ARDS, Reflux esophagitis, Duodenal ulcer
General Line of Treatment: Fluid and O2 requirement along with inotropes, Mechanical ventilation if needed; careful fluid management; platelet transfusion if critically low; PPI for GI lesions; avoid NSAIDs; monitor ABG; ICU care for ALI/ARDS

Patient narratives: A 14 years old boy having localized loss of hair and itchylesions in the scalp since few months sir this is case of cicatriacial alopecia please help us to take the history of this patient indetail. Sir , in this patient from the vertex on left side where wesee patches of alopecia with hyper pigmentation and atrophy usinga 4 mm punch we can take the biopsy. Clean the area and underproper asepsis after injecting 2 %lignocaine locally biopsycan.
Diagnosis: alopecia areata, Cicatricial (scarring) alopecia, Tinea capitis (rule out), Lichen planopilaris
General Line of Treatment: Intralesional steroids, Scalp biopsy for definitive diagnosis; antifungals if tinea confirmed; hydroxychloroquine for inflammatory cicatricial alopecia; dermatology referral

Patient narratives:
25 year old healthcare professional develops fever, nausea andvomitting. 2 days later he has yellowing of urine. LFT showsraised enzymes beyond 2000 IU, total bilirubin 3.8. 
INR 1.07.Repeat LFT after 2 days bilirubin 6.8, SGPT 3700.2 months back he has H/O intake of PEP with Zidovudine,Lamivudine, Lopinavir, Ritonavir for 1 month.IgM anti Hep A positive.
Diagnosis: Acute viral hepatitis resolving phase, Drug-induced liver injury (DILI) from antiretroviral PEP (contributory)
General Line of Treatment: Conservative management, Rest and hydration; discontinue hepatotoxic drugs; monitor LFTs, INR, bilirubin closely; avoid alcohol; hepatology referral; consider N-acetylcysteine if DILI component significant; monitor for acute liver failure

Patient narratives:
A 74 year old man with arthritis since 2 years and recurrentintermiitent angiodedema since 2 months angioedema is not common with rheumatoid arthritis but inthis patient there is associated history of hypertension anddiabetes both which can be the factors?? angioedema could be because of autoimmune factor inrheumatoid arthritis (perhaps only one case reported) and is morecommon with other autoimmune diseases. angioedema over jointswith pain may be associated with arthritis. Today I had time to look at the pictures for the firsttime. 
I do not see the angioedema. As the angioedema is occurringtwo years after the onset of the rheumatoid arthritis, I wonderif they are connected. As I commented earlier, I would be moreconcerned about a reaction to NSAIDs. 
First we must document thatthis patient does have angioedema , how was the diagnosismade??.
Diagnosis: ??Drug induced angioedema, Rheumatoid arthritis, Recurrent angioedema (NSAID-induced vs. idiopathic vs. ACE-inhibitor-induced)
General Line of Treatment: Withdrawal of NSAIDS, Review and discontinue ACE inhibitors if implicated; antihistamines (cetirizine); short-course corticosteroids for acute angioedema; DMARDs (methotrexate) for RA; C1-esterase inhibitor levels to rule out hereditary angioedema; allergy/immunology referral

Patient narratives: A 40 year old man with irregular swelling of the right footsince 4 years Sir I have not seen this patient Sir this patient is not in my unit. Sir this patient is not in my unit.
Diagnosis: Varicose vein, Madura foot (Mycetoma), Chronic fungal/actinomycotic infection of foot
General Line of Treatment: USG doppler of lower limb and surgery, Imaging (X-ray, MRI) to assess bone involvement; culture and sensitivity of discharge; antifungals (itraconazole) for eumycetoma; antibiotics (co-trimoxazole, amikacin) for actinomycetoma; surgical debridement if needed

Patient narratives: We were unable to figure out why this 22 year old woman hadPolyarthritis for last 7 years,abdominal lymph-nodal tuberculosissince last 7 months, and pancreatitis 3 months with now recentlynoticed large liver cirrhosis and ascites.
Diagnosis: ?Autoimmune hepatitis, Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE), Abdominal Tuberculosis, Pancreatitis, Liver Cirrhosis with Ascites
General Line of Treatment: Steroids, Immunosuppressants (hydroxychloroquine, azathioprine), Anti-tubercular therapy (HRZE regimen), Pancreatic enzyme support, Diuretics and albumin infusion for ascites, hepatoprotective measures

Patient narratives:
Currently we are managing this 23 year old lady suffering fromsymptoms of malabsorption syndrome since the last 14 years whenshe was given a diagnosis of gluten sensitive enteropathy at theage of 9. No other neurological manifestations although not all ofthem may be present in all patients. The diagnosis of Coeliac wasmade 14 years back in Govt Medical College, Bhopal possibly as anassumption to see if she would respond to a gluten free diet(a Great to hear from Professor Dilawari(Santanu, Pralay, VivekJha, LakshmiKant Jha, Tarun Chakrabarti). 
We inquired and found that many laboratories in Indiahave discontinued the 72 hour Fecal fat test possibly due to theunpleasant logistic issues Please comment on:1 what were her symptoms when she was diagnosed CD.2. Was there D2 biopsy done.?.
Diagnosis: 1)diarrhoea, abdominal pain 2)no, Malabsorption Syndrome, Possible Coeliac Disease (Gluten-Sensitive Enteropathy) - diagnosis under review
General Line of Treatment: Gluten free diet, duodenal (D2) biopsy for confirmation, anti-tTG and anti-endomysial antibodies, 72-hour fecal fat test or fecal elastase, nutritional supplementation (iron, folate, B12, calcium, vitamin D), consider alternative causes of malabsorption if biopsy negative

Patient narratives: A 40 year old woman with joint pains since 6 years
Diagnosis: ?Rhematoid arthritis ? Osteoarthritis, connective tissue disorder
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDS, Investigations: RF, anti-CCP, ANA, ESR, CRP, X-rays, DMARDs (methotrexate) if RA confirmed, physiotherapy

Patient narratives: A 16 yr old obese girl has presented to us with acutepancreatitis and diabetes mellitus....... How do we progress toinvestigate the cause of pancreatitis in this girl? Its an interesting case.
Diagnosis: Rule out hyperlipidemia, hypercalcemia, Ig G4 related diseases, Acute Pancreatitis, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (or Pancreatogenic Diabetes), Obesity, gallstones, hereditary pancreatitis
General Line of Treatment: IV fluids, analgesics, NPO initially, investigate: serum triglycerides, lipid profile, USG abdomen, MRCP, HbA1c, fasting insulin, genetic testing for hereditary pancreatitis, insulin for glycemic control, treat underlying cause (fibrates for hypertriglyceridemia), weight management

Patient narratives: 31 year old woman with polyarthritis since 2008 All I can tell from reading the record is the patient hadrheumatoid arthritis, had a high sedimentation rate and is onmedal 4 mg daily.
Diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis
General Line of Treatment: DMARDS, Methylprednisolone (Medrol) as bridging therapy, NSAIDs, monitor ESR, CRP, RF, anti-CCP, consider biologics (anti-TNF) if inadequate response, physiotherapy

Patient narratives: 65 year old woman with intermittent palpitations and chestpain since 2014.
Diagnosis: Congestive cardiac failure, Cardiac Arrhythmia (Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation or SVT), Ischemic Heart Disease - to be evaluated
General Line of Treatment: Diuretics, 12-lead ECG, Holter monitoring, Echocardiography, stress test, lipid profile, Beta-blockers or calcium channel blockers for rate control, anticoagulation if AF confirmed, nitrates/aspirin if ischemic component, lifestyle modification

Patient narratives: A 21 year old man with fever, pain and swelling in his leftleg since the last 2 months.
Diagnosis: Left leg cellulitis, Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT), Osteomyelitis - to be excluded
General Line of Treatment: antibiotics, Doppler USG of left leg, CBC, ESR, CRP, blood cultures, X-ray/MRI if osteomyelitis suspected, Anticoagulation (LMWH/warfarin/DOAC) for DVT, surgical drainage if abscess, investigate for underlying hypercoagulable state

Patient narratives: A 40 year old man with gradual paralysis of both lower limbsand bedridden since 2 months
Diagnosis: ADEM ?Multiple sclerosis, Spinal cord compression, Transverse Myelitis, Spinal TB, Motor Neuron Disease - to be excluded
General Line of Treatment: MRI spine and Steroids, Rituximab, MRI spine (whole spine), CSF analysis, chest X-ray, Mantoux test, ANA, VDRL, Vitamin B12, if spinal TB: anti-tubercular therapy + corticosteroids, if compressive: surgical decompression, physiotherapy and rehabilitation, bladder/bowel care

Patient narratives: 49 year old man with intermittent right sided neck pains andright arm paralysis since the last 6 years:.
Diagnosis: Cervical spondylosis, Cervical Myelopathy/Radiculopathy, Right C5-C6/C6-C7 nerve root compression
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDS, muscle relaxants, physiotherapy, cervical traction, MRI cervical spine, nerve conduction studies/EMG, if myelopathy: surgical decompression (ACDF or laminectomy), Gabapentin/Pregabalin for neuropathic pain

Patient narratives: A 35 year old man with diabetes and skin eruptions since 3years and loss of both lower limb sensations since last 1year
Diagnosis: Diabetic neuropathy, Diabetic Dermopathy or Necrobiosis Lipoidica (skin eruptions)
General Line of Treatment: Amitryptilline, Glycemic control (Metformin, insulin if needed), HbA1c monitoring, Pregabalin/Gabapentin or Duloxetine for neuropathic pain, Methylcobalamin (B12) supplementation, wound care, dermatology referral for skin lesions, lipid and BP control, annual foot and eye examination

Patient narratives: A 45 year old man with neck & upper limb pain along withdifficulty in walking since 6 years
Diagnosis: Cervical Spondylotic Myelopathy, Cervical Radiculopathy
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, physiotherapy, cervical collar; surgical decompression (anterior cervical discectomy/fusion) if progressive myelopathy

Patient narratives: 70 year old woman with knee pains and low back ache this patient has had one of our community health workerstype her history in English.
Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis of knee, Lumbar Spondylosis
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, analgesics, physiotherapy, weight management, intra-articular corticosteroid injections, knee replacement if severe

Patient narratives: A 60 year old woman with progressive abdominal wall tumorsince last 2 years
Diagnosis: Desmoid Tumor (Abdominal Wall Fibromatosis), Abdominal Wall Sarcoma
General Line of Treatment: Surgical excision with wide margins, NSAIDs (sulindac), tyrosine kinase inhibitors (imatinib), radiotherapy for unresectable cases

Patient narratives: A 49 year old woman with vomiting and pain abdomen since 1month
Diagnosis: ? Gastritis, Acute Pancreatitis, Peptic Ulcer Disease, Intestinal Obstruction
General Line of Treatment: Antacids, IV fluids, analgesics, antiemetics, NPO, proton pump inhibitors, investigate with ultrasound/CT abdomen, treat underlying cause

Patient narratives: A 59 year old man with skin lesions and breathlessness since 2months.
Diagnosis: Sarcoidosis, Cutaneous Lymphoma, Metastatic Skin Disease with pulmonary involvement
General Line of Treatment: Systemic corticosteroids (sarcoidosis), biopsy-guided chemotherapy or targeted therapy; pulmonary function assessment

Patient narratives: 40 year old woman with difficulty in urination since 20
Diagnosis: UTI, Urethral Stricture, Neurogenic Bladder, Bladder Outlet Obstruction
General Line of Treatment: Antibiotics, Urodynamic studies, cystoscopy, urethral dilation, intermittent catheterization, anticholinergics or alpha-blockers as indicated

Patient narratives: 42 year old woman with pelvic pain and irregularmenstruation.
Diagnosis: Pelvic inflammatory disease, Endometriosis, Uterine Fibroids, Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
General Line of Treatment: Antibiotics, Hormonal therapy (OCP, progestins, GnRH agonists), NSAIDs for pain, laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis/fibroids

Patient narratives: 5 year old boy with inability to talk and walk since 4 yearsof age.
Diagnosis: Cerebral palsy, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Global Developmental Delay
General Line of Treatment: MRI Brain, physitherapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, behavioral therapy (ABA), anticonvulsants if seizures present

Patient narratives: 26 year old woman with anemia since the last 2 years
Diagnosis: Iron deficiency anemia, Anemia of Chronic Disease, Hemolytic Anemia
General Line of Treatment: Iron supplements, Investigate cause (CBC, peripheral smear, ferritin, B12, folate), B12/folate if deficient, treat underlying cause

Patient narratives: 32 year old woman with an intramural fibroid We are trying to get around the problem of difficult toread hand writing by asking our 'community health entrepreneur'to write with a printed hand:
Diagnosis: Intramural Uterine Fibroid (Leiomyoma)
General Line of Treatment: GnRH agonists, tranexamic acid, NSAIDs for symptom control; myomectomy (laparoscopic/open) or hysterectomy; uterine artery embolization

Patient narratives: A 78 year old woman with a cutaneous ulcer as well as aduodenal ulcer and renal failure This patient has again gotten admitted this time not withhematemesis but with persistent vomiting.
Diagnosis: Chronic kidney disease with uremic symptoms, Peptic ulcer disease (duodenal ulcer), Cutaneous ulcer
General Line of Treatment: Hemodialysis, RRT, Proton pump inhibitors, H. pylori eradication if indicated, antiemetics, renal-dose adjusted medications, wound care for cutaneous ulcer

Patient narratives: A 17 year old man with recurrent jaundice and night sweatssince 2 months.
Diagnosis: Infectious mononucleosis, Lymphoma (Hodgkin's), Viral hepatitis
General Line of Treatment: Investigate with LFTs, CBC, EBV/CMV serology, LDH, lymph node biopsy if lymphoma suspected; supportive care; oncology referral if malignancy confirmed

Patient narratives:
A 45-year-old man having pain and burning sensation in wholebody and left frozen shoulder since six months we have planned for hot water fomentation in home and SWDND UST given along with that we have planned self stretching ndcaudmann,s pendular exercise can you support your management plan with some evidenceafter review of literature. Just google, frozen shoulder evidencebased management and let us know the salient points mentionedthere so that we can take this discussion forward. You need more history. 
All you have now is a shoulder thatwill not move. Did the patient have an injury in the past?? Couldhe have either a developmental abnormality or even past infectionin the shoulder? What about his paresthesias? What was hisneurologic exam like?
Diagnosis: Adhesive capsulitis (frozen shoulder), Cervical radiculopathy (to be ruled out)
General Line of Treatment: Short-wave diathermy, ultrasound therapy, hot fomentation, Codman's pendular exercises, self-stretching, NSAIDs, intra-articular corticosteroid injection if needed, physiotherapy; rule out neurological and structural causes

Patient narratives: A 32 year old man with post ejaculatory urinary burning since6 years
Diagnosis: Benign prostatic hyperplasia, Chronic prostatitis, Post-ejaculatory dysuria, Sexually transmitted infection (to be ruled out)
General Line of Treatment: Tamsulosin, Urine culture, STI screening, prostate evaluation, antibiotics (fluoroquinolones) if bacterial prostatitis confirmed, anti-inflammatory agents, pelvic floor physiotherapy

Patient narratives: during a survey conducted by our psm department i found a 35yrs old man with severe cough n dyspnoea for last one last year.cough is productive n stains d walls black or brown black. sleepis disturbed too.he works in a cement factory. case of pneumoconiosis???
Diagnosis: Pneumoconiosis, Occupational lung disease
General Line of Treatment: Bronchodilators, Chest X-ray, HRCT thorax, PFTs, occupational history documentation, remove from exposure, treat infections, pulmonary rehabilitation

Patient narratives: A 42 year old man with stiffness and difficulty in walkingsince 6 months primarily a result of apparent cervical myelopathydue to trauma 6 months back
Diagnosis: Cervical myelopathy (traumatic), Spastic paraparesis
General Line of Treatment: MRI cervical spine, neurological assessment; surgical decompression if indicated, physiotherapy, muscle relaxants (baclofen), neuroprotective agents, gait rehabilitation

Patient narratives: A 50 year old woman with DM-2 since 4-5 years and fever since2 months
Diagnosis: Tuberculosis, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus with fever of unknown origin, Diabetic foot infection or occult infection (to be ruled out)
General Line of Treatment: Antitubercular therapy, Blood cultures, urine culture, imaging, glycemic control (insulin), broad-spectrum antibiotics if infection confirmed, investigate for UTI, fungal infections common in diabetics

Patient narratives: A 30-year-old man living in Boston presented to the emergencydepartment in late March with fevers and shaking chills
Diagnosis: Babesiosis, Malaria (Plasmodium falciparum), Infectious endocarditis (to be ruled out)
General Line of Treatment: Blood smear, PCR for Babesia and Plasmodium; Babesiosis: atovaquone + azithromycin or clindamycin + quinine; supportive care; exchange transfusion if severe

Patient narratives: A 44 year old woman with menorrhagia for your inputs http://www.udhc.co.in/INPUT/displayIssueGraphically.jsp...Will be great if some of our group members can translate therelevant sections of this patient's Bengali handwritten historyinto English. The history suggests abnormal bleeding. But the Hb (done 1yr ago) was normal.
Diagnosis: Menorrhagia, Uterine fibroids or dysfunctional uterine bleeding (to be ruled out)
General Line of Treatment: Pelvic ultrasound, CBC, coagulation profile, hormonal assay; NSAIDs, tranexamic acid, hormonal therapy (OCP/progestins), hysteroscopy/myomectomy if fibroids confirmed

Patient narratives: A young man with arthritis of left ankle followed byadditional pain and swelling developing over right knee followedby additional left wrist arthritis. We were initially not sure ofthe diagnosis until one of our medical students got a goodhistory from the patient:
Diagnosis: Reactive arthritis (Reiter's syndrome), Migratory polyarthritis
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs (first line), STI/GI infection screening and treatment, sulfasalazine or methotrexate for chronic cases, physiotherapy; HLA-B27 testing

Patient narratives: A 65 year old man with paralysis of right upper and lowerlimbs since 7 months
Diagnosis: Stroke, Hemiplegia (right-sided)
General Line of Treatment: Antiplatelet therapy (aspirin/clopidogrel) or anticoagulation if cardioembolic, antihypertensives, statins, physiotherapy and rehabilitation, occupational therapy

Patient narratives: Our recent patient from Kolkata here in Bhopal, a past weightlifter in Kolkata police, relates developing a knee dislocationonce (subsequently proven to be a cruciate ligament tear...seerecent MRI done here) and yet within months of the knee injurywent on to win a local competition by lifting a heavy weight ofmore than 600 kilos. Currently here with recurrent cellulitissince the last few years
Diagnosis: Cruciate ligament tear (healed/chronic), Recurrent cellulitis
General Line of Treatment: Physiotherapy and knee bracing for ligament stability; antibiotics (penicillin/cephalosporins) for cellulitis, compression therapy, skin hygiene, prophylactic antibiotics for recurrent episodes

Patient narratives: A 10 year old child admitted with fever (intermittent) for 3months,joint pain in both knees and also back and wrist joint andthumb of left hand.Purpuric spots over abdomen,back of arm andback of thigh (both),no ecchymoses.History of moderate weightloss.Moderate pallor,swelling of both the knees and left wrist,nohemarthrosis,mild icterus.No significant bone pain.Noinvestigation reports done.What are the possible differentialdiagnoses upto this stage?
Diagnosis: Juvenile idiopathic arthritis, Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia, Henoch-Schönlein Purpura, Reactive arthritis, Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (juvenile onset)
General Line of Treatment: Steroids, DMARDS, Pending investigations (CBC, peripheral smear, ANA, RF, anti-CCP, urine analysis, bone marrow biopsy if leukemia suspected), NSAIDs depending on confirmed diagnosis

Patient narratives: A 37 year old man having Right sided Abdominal pain since 4years and a lump since 2 years.
Diagnosis: Right-sided abdominal mass with pain — differential: Renal cell carcinoma, Hepatic mass (HCC or metastasis), Retroperitoneal tumor, Colonic carcinoma
General Line of Treatment: Imaging (USG, CT abdomen), tumor markers, biopsy; surgical resection if operable, chemotherapy/targeted therapy/immunotherapy based on histology

Patient narratives: A 36 year old man with severe knee arthritis and contractures(along with involvement of other joints including hands),progressive since 2 years
Diagnosis: Osteoarthritis, Rheumatoid Arthritis with joint contractures, Psoriatic Arthritis (differential)
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDS, DMARDs (Methotrexate, Hydroxychloroquine, Sulfasalazine), biologics (TNF inhibitors) if refractory, corticosteroids, physiotherapy, occupational therapy

Patient narratives: A 60 year old woman with fatigue and reduced appetite for 1year
Diagnosis: Malignancy, Hypothyroidism, Anemia, Depression, Chronic kidney disease, Diabetes mellitus
General Line of Treatment: Depends on the site of malignancy, Investigations (CBC, TFT, RFT, LFT, blood glucose, cancer screening); treat underlying cause — thyroid hormone replacement, hematinics, antidepressants, or oncology referral as appropriate

Patient narratives: An 50 yr male patient having this skin problemsymptoms arewhite patches on both for arm n both of his for legshaving dryness with cracking without any oozing of fluidwith itching.
Diagnosis: Atopic dermatitis, Psoriasis (plaque type), Ichthyosis (differential)
General Line of Treatment: Topical steroids, emollients/moisturizers, Vitamin D analogues (calcipotriol), keratolytics (salicylic acid); systemic therapy (methotrexate, acitretin) if extensive; antihistamines for pruritus

Patient narratives: a 40 yr old man with complaints of fever, fatigue and memoryloss since 1 week
Diagnosis: Acute febrile illness with neuropsychiatric features — differential: Viral encephalitis (Herpes simplex, Japanese encephalitis), Cerebral malaria, Typhoid encephalopathy, Meningitis, HIV encephalopathy
General Line of Treatment: Urgent investigations (CBC, malaria smear/RDT, CSF analysis, MRI brain, HIV test, blood cultures); empirical acyclovir for HSV encephalitis, antimalarials if malaria confirmed, antibiotics for bacterial meningitis

Patient narratives: 14 year old boy with Urinary incontinence, Knock knees, lowerlimb weakness and bone pains
Diagnosis: Hyperparathyroidism, Rickets (Nutritional Vitamin D deficiency), Genu Valgum, Neurogenic bladder or spinal cord pathology causing urinary incontinence
General Line of Treatment: Vitamin D and calcium supplementation, dietary correction; orthopedic evaluation for genu valgum (bracing or corrective osteotomy if severe); urological evaluation (urodynamics), physiotherapy for lower limb weakness

Patient narratives: 38 year old woman with complaints of severe neck pain and handpains radiating from the right shoulder since few months
Diagnosis: Cervical spondylosis with cervical radiculopathy, Cervical disc herniation
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, muscle relaxants, cervical collar/traction, physiotherapy; nerve root injections if refractory; surgical decompression (ACDF) if neurological deficit progresses

Patient narratives: A 40 year old man with abdominal distension.for 2 years.
Diagnosis: GI Malignancy, Ascites, Liver Cirrhosis
General Line of Treatment: Surgery and chemo, Diuretics (spironolactone, furosemide), low-sodium diet, paracentesis if tense ascites, treat underlying cause

Patient narratives: a 17 year old boy with fever and dry cough since 15 days.
Diagnosis: Asthma, Atypical Pneumonia, Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection
General Line of Treatment: Inhaled bronchodilators, Macrolide antibiotics (azithromycin), supportive care, antipyretics

Patient narratives: 30 yr old man with complaints of fever and bodyache since 4months and pain in right upper abdomen since 15 days
Diagnosis: Hepatic Abscess (Amoebic), Entamoeba histolytica infection
General Line of Treatment: Metronidazole (high dose), followed by luminal amoebicide (diloxanide furoate), ultrasound-guided aspiration if needed

Patient narratives: A young male with history of chronic alcoholism. Presents tothe emergency dept. with History of Severe abdominal pain andrespiratory distress.
Diagnosis: Acute Pancreatitis, Alcoholic pancreatitis with pleural effusion
General Line of Treatment: IV fluids resuscitation, NPO, analgesics (opioids), oxygen supplementation, monitoring for complications, ICU care

Patient narratives: Extreme Headache since 1 year
Diagnosis: Migraine, Tension-type headache, Secondary headache (rule out intracranial pathology)
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, Triptans for acute attacks, prophylaxis with beta-blockers/topiramate/amitriptyline, neuroimaging to rule out secondary causes

Patient narratives: 18 yrs young man with seizures following febrile illness alongwith forgetfulness and weakness in all 4 limbs since 8 years.
Diagnosis: Post-encephalitic Epilepsy, Viral Encephalitis sequelae, Spastic Quadriparesis
General Line of Treatment: Antiepileptic drugs (valproate, levetiracetam), physiotherapy, cognitive rehabilitation, supportive care

Patient narratives: 35 year old woman with low grade fever for 4 months andassociated chronic diarrhoea
Diagnosis: IBD, Intestinal Tuberculosis, HIV/AIDS with opportunistic infection
General Line of Treatment: Sulfasalasine, Anti-tubercular therapy (HRZE regimen), HIV testing and ART if positive, nutritional support, probiotics

Patient narratives: 66 year old woman with swelling in legs
Diagnosis: CCF, Chronic Venous Insufficiency
General Line of Treatment: Diuretics (furosemide), ACE inhibitors, leg elevation, compression stockings, treat underlying cause (cardiac/renal/hepatic)

Patient narratives: 75 year old smoker presented with dry cough and low gradefever since 15 days.on examination he was afebrile.no clubbing nocyanosis resp. Rate 16/min.systemic examn nl trachea central,except reduced air entry on left side with hyperresonance
Diagnosis: COPD, Spontaneous Pneumothorax, Lung malignancy (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: Inhaled bronchodilators, Chest tube insertion/intercostal drainage, oxygen therapy, bronchoscopy and CT chest to rule out malignancy, surgical intervention if recurrent

Patient narratives: 70 yrs old male came with complaints of Tingling sensation inboth lower limbs since 2 months, unable to walk for 1 month, andurinary incontinence for 1 month
Diagnosis: Neuropathy, Spinal Cord Compression, Cervical/Thoracic Myelopathy, Subacute Combined Degeneration (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: Amitryptilline, MRI spine, neurosurgical evaluation, IV methylprednisolone, physiotherapy, urological management, treat underlying cause (B12 deficiency/tumor/disc)

Patient narratives: A 60yrs old female patient presented with the complaint ofdizziness and vomiting.
Diagnosis: Stroke, Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo (BPPV) or Central Vertigo
General Line of Treatment: Aspirin, physiotherapy, Epley maneuver for BPPV, antiemetics (ondansetron, metoclopramide), vestibular suppressants (meclizine, betahistine), investigate for central causes if indicated

Patient narratives: 36 years old woman with polyarthritis for 20 years
Diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis
General Line of Treatment: DMARDS, NSAIDs for symptom relief, corticosteroids for flares, biologic agents (TNF inhibitors) if refractory, regular monitoring

Patient narratives: A 57 yrs old female patient presented with dyspnea, cough withexpectoration, and mild fever
Diagnosis: Tuberculosis, Community-Acquired Pneumonia or Acute Exacerbation of COPD
General Line of Treatment: Antitubercular therapy, antibiotics (amoxicillin-clavulanate or azithromycin), bronchodilators, expectorants, antipyretics, chest physiotherapy, oxygen if needed

Patient narratives: 27 year old woman with unexplained infertility for 2 years
Diagnosis: PCOD, Endometriosis (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: Oral contraceptive pills, progesterone, hormonal evaluation, HSG, laparoscopy if indicated, ovulation induction (clomiphene, letrozole), IUI or IVF, lifestyle modification

Patient narratives: 70 year old man with shortness of breath and body swelling
Diagnosis: Congestive cardiac failure, Cor Pulmonale or Chronic Kidney Disease with fluid overload
General Line of Treatment: Diuretics, ACE inhibitors/ARBs, beta-blockers, aldosterone antagonists, fluid and salt restriction, treat underlying cause, oxygen therapy

Patient narratives: This 45 year old woman came with cough and low grade fever of1 month duration , there is also history of significant weightloss. No hemoptysis or chest pain. No family history oftuberculosis.
Diagnosis: Tuberculosis, Lung Malignancy (differential)
General Line of Treatment: Antitubercular therapy, sputum AFB smear/culture, CBNAAT, chest X-ray, CT chest, if TB confirmed: RNTCP regimen (HRZE/HR), if malignancy suspected: biopsy, PET scan, oncology referral

Patient narratives: This 25 year old woman came with pain and some swelling in herright wrist of four months duration. With no response to routineanti inflammatory meds. No other joints have any pain or swelling.
Diagnosis: Carpal tunnel syndrome, Septic Arthritis, Reactive Arthritis or Early Rheumatoid Arthritis (monoarthritis)
General Line of Treatment: Surgery, joint aspiration for culture/sensitivity, if septic: IV antibiotics, if reactive/inflammatory: NSAIDs, corticosteroid injection, rheumatology referral, ANA, RF, anti-CCP workup

Patient narratives: A 7 year old girl with a wheeze every evening since the last 3months
Diagnosis: Bronchial asthma
General Line of Treatment: Inhaled bronchodilators, inhaled short-acting beta-2 agonists (salbutamol) as reliever, inhaled corticosteroids (budesonide) as controller, leukotriene receptor antagonists, allergen avoidance, spirometry/peak flow monitoring

Patient narratives: a patient presents with shortness of breath, fever and araised ESR. On examination he had rash on his trunk and arms
Diagnosis: Viral exanthem, Adult-onset Still's Disease, Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
General Line of Treatment: Conservative management, CBC, ESR, CRP, ANA, anti-dsDNA, ferritin, blood cultures, NSAIDs, corticosteroids, DMARDs (methotrexate, hydroxychloroquine) if autoimmune confirmed, rheumatology referral

Patient narratives: A 7 years old child with intermittent left lumbar abdominalpain.
Diagnosis: Renal calculi, Ureteropelvic Junction Obstruction, Hydronephrosis
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, SURGERY, hydration, alpha-blockers for stone passage, urology referral for obstruction or large stones

Patient narratives: A 50 years old man with abdominal pain and loss of appetitesince 1 month
Diagnosis: Gastric cancer, Peptic ulcer disease, Chronic gastritis
General Line of Treatment: Surgery and chemo, PPI therapy, H. pylori eradication if positive, endoscopy for evaluation, nutritional support

Patient narratives: A 50 year old woman with Diabetes since 10 years and recentknee pains and uncontrolled blood sugars
Diagnosis: Diabetic neuropathy, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (uncontrolled), Diabetic osteoarthropathy, Obesity-related osteoarthritis
General Line of Treatment: Amitryptilline, Optimization of antidiabetic therapy (metformin, SGLT2 inhibitors or GLP-1 agonists), NSAIDs/physiotherapy for knee pain, weight management

Patient narratives: A 31 year old woman with left knee pain and swelling since 6months and cough since 2 weeks
Diagnosis: DVT with pulmonary embolism, Tubercular arthritis (left knee), Pulmonary tuberculosis
General Line of Treatment: Anticoagulation, Anti-tubercular therapy (HRZE regimen for 6-9 months), joint aspiration/biopsy for confirmation, physiotherapy

Patient narratives: An 18 years old girl with polyarthritis since 1 year:
Diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis, Juvenile idiopathic arthritis, Rheumatic fever (rule out), Systemic lupus erythematosus (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: DMARDS, NSAIDs, corticosteroids if needed, rheumatology referral, ANA/RF/ASO workup

Patient narratives: A 50 years old woman with severe right sided headache since 5days
Diagnosis: Migraine, Cluster headache, Trigeminal neuralgia (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: NSAIDs, Triptans (sumatriptan) for acute attack, prophylaxis with beta-blockers or topiramate, neurological evaluation

Patient narratives: A 70 year man with diabetes since 2 years and large boweldiarrhea since 4 months His diabetes appeared relatively well controlled but hislarge bowel diarrhea has been relentless
Diagnosis: IBD, Diabetic autonomic neuropathy (diabetic diarrhea), Colorectal malignancy (rule out)
General Line of Treatment: Sulfasalasine, Colonoscopy to rule out malignancy, loperamide or codeine for symptomatic diarrhea, antibiotics if bacterial overgrowth, optimize glycemic control

Patient narratives: 60 year old woman with Diabetes since 2009 and recentcellulitis As far as I can see from the records her DM duration is abt7 years..... Her sugars are pretty much uncontrolled with HbA1cabove 13..
Diagnosis: Diabetes, Cellulitis
General Line of Treatment: Insulin, IV/oral antibiotics (cloxacillin, amoxicillin-clavulanate), wound care, hospitalization if severe

Patient narratives: A 45 years old woman with abdominal pain, fever and jaundicesince 2 weeks: you have seen this patient.
Diagnosis: Acute viral hepatitis, Acute cholangitis, Choledocholithiasis, Biliary obstruction (Charcot's triad)
General Line of Treatment: Conservative management, IV antibiotics (piperacillin-tazobactam), ERCP with stone extraction, biliary drainage, surgical consultation

Patient narratives: 44 yr man presented with fever, diarrhoea, dizziness &sweating. Initially BP was 100/60 with moderate dehydration. CRP50 with normal counts, Hb, Creatinine, Na/K & ECG.
Diagnosis: Acute gastroentritis, Sepsis (early/mild)
General Line of Treatment: Antacids, IV fluid resuscitation (normal saline), oral rehydration therapy, antiemetics, empirical antibiotics if bacterial cause suspected, electrolyte correction, monitoring

Patient narratives: A 45 years old man with chest pain since 5 months anddifficulty in breathing since 1 month
Diagnosis: Congestive cardiac failure, Ischemic heart disease, Stable angina
General Line of Treatment: Diuretics, ECG, stress test, echocardiography, coronary angiography, antiplatelet therapy (aspirin), beta-blockers, nitrates, statins, revascularization if indicated
